Design Thinking for Innovation      Name: Milton Desai

The Design thinking assist us in expressing the person need for settling matter in person that  generates number of fresh suggestions in mental talks, and modifying a brand-new entrance to  original pattern or blueprints using opportunities which is a interconnection receive to the  difficulty keeping process particularly high pointed in business education colleges. Business  education college trainer feel DT in a new or step wise process, to be a much greater than  theirs capacity of time and asset pressure. The experiment practice gives a nice easy and not so  much expenditure approach to occupy an idea of DT into an any type of course. With no  much preparation, the members can have a best incident using designthinking to approach a  perfect problem use up at least an class period. This course is suitable any business education  schools. The provided lesson , workbook make  easily to patch students' knowing of the design  thinking process.

Design Thinking – Edgar Lara

1.- CHALLENGE AND SELECTION: a local cafeteria located in the center of the city  considered among its development plans to expand its menu in order to increase its  profit margin, since it had remained stagnant during the last 2 years; The idea of its  owners was to create a special menu for children as the cafeteria is located relatively  close to two study centers and additionally it was very common for parents to come to  the place with their children. However, for the most part they were companions of their  parents, but they did not consume local products; and the consumption was carried out  in other places in the vicinity.

The problem with this situation was that although the owners had hypotheses about  which dishes may be attractive to children, in the end they were not sure of the  reception they would have once they were on the menu.

Likewise, it was a priority to analyze the viability of the project to start it up, since recent  adaptation and remodeling of the premises to make it more attractive to customers  meant large investments, which is why it was important to increase the level of profit  for stability of the business.

2.- APPLICATION: Considering the antecedents, the generated action plan consisted in  that for a week, the children who enter the premises or who visit the surroundings  would be offered to choose between several selected products and dishes which they  would most like to taste, to then receive feedback on the taste and presentation of it;  and once this information has been compiled, consider which would be the most  selected product (s) and those with the best criticism to add to the menu; Likewise, the  details related to the presentation of the product would be considered to be more  attractive.

3.- INSIGHT & APPROACH: In this way, once the application process has been carried  out and with a minimum investment, it could be defined from the first source, which  with the dishes that will have the highest and lowest output to be considered in their  production plans. Likewise, through the information collected, modifications were  considered regarding the ingredients or preparation; Likewise, through this information  it was possible to define the most attractive presentation for targeted clients and in this  way determine, which would be the dishes to add to the menu; During the course of the  following months, the restaurant increased its profitability, as well as the number of  customers increased, which is why the application of the chosen technique gave the  expected results.

PEER-GRADED ASSIGNMENT: REFLECTION

DESIGN THINKING FOR INNOVATION.  BY: Shailesh Jain

1.  Challenge:

I am the general manager of a Music Record Label in Colombia. Our company has one  of the largest independent music catalogs in Latin America. Technological and cultural  changes have made people consume music digitally through mobile applications such  as Spotify, Deezer, Apple Music, etc. The sale of physical formats such as vinyl records  and compact discs has fallen to almost nothing. However, there is a musical product  that we want to keep as tangible, it is the "14 Dancing Cannon shots". This is a  compilation of the best musical themes during the year. This music compilation is highly  expected in the December season because they represent the arrival of the end of the  year holidays.  The challenge then is: Can the product be released in a different physical format from  CDs and vinyl records and at the same time incorporating a technological development  that also induces consumption on digital music platforms?

2. Selection:

The chosen tool was Visualization. Since it was about making a creative proposal of a  musical format different from the traditional ones, it was important for the  communication that there be a non-verbal description of what the people involved in the  process   wanted    to    express.    As    Lorena Hidalgo    explains    in    the    video.   it tries to awaken parts of our mind in which We relate the images with our ideas, the  creative part and artistic talent to improve, not only the generation of new own  perspectives, but also facilitate communication with peers. So this was a requirement  communicated to all project participants.

3. Application:

In order to generate a more effective integration between the different departments of  the company, an integration that has been affected by working at home due to the  COVID 19 epidemic, several work teams were made in order to make a proposal. . For  this, a methodology based on the PAGES tool (Acronym for Parts, Actions, Goals,  Events and Self Concept) was proposed. This methodology is well described in the  course.  In order for everyone to know this tool, I gave them an introductory lecture and gave  them examples of how to use it. The departments that participated were: Marketing  Department, Artistic Department, Sales Department, Children's content department, IT  and technology department. They were given a week to think and use visualization  resources in order to present the proposal. After all the teams presented their ideas,  each of them chose a representative. With these representatives, a "super team" was  created in order to take the best of each of the proposals and make a final proposal,  which would be presented for adjustments to all the participants jointly.

4. Insight:

The results were surprising, even though each department inevitably biased its  concepts according to their expertise, at the end an idea was reached in which everyone  felt represented. The fact of presenting the proposal graphically led each team to look  for ways to communicate, either by extracting images from the Internet, some with  freehand drawings, etc. that allowed a better communication that could be assimilated  by people of different types of knowledge. Since the challenge consisted in thinking “out  of the box” there was a lot of freedom and risk in the approaches, some of them quite  “flown”  Managers always have a certain prevention in giving too much participation, because  sometimes actions and processes must be carried out with some rigidity to fulfill the  mission entrusted by the shareholders who own the company. From this “democratic”  exercise there was a feeling of empowerment and greater belonging on the part of the  employees. Furthermore, the contribution from different areas was effectively reflected  in the richness of the result.  To illustrate a bit the result of the exercise, I attach these images that represent the  resulting proposal and that was developed in the final session.

5. Approach:

For certain projects that involve innovation and creativity, it is important that each  person in key departments of the company get involved with the ideas because, from  their own perspectives, there are aspects that must be considered and that give more  security in the success of a project. Since we are a small company in number of  employees, practically all of them were involved in the exercise and this led to continued  interest in the development of this product, which by the way, is not finished yet. It is  expected that it is released in October 2021. In future developments there will be a more  participatory and “democratic” approach to obtain this type of unexpected but innovative  results.

Kamrul Javed 14/11/2018

Visualisation tool for drone development

Challenge

I own a drone solutions company and my/our challenge is to always improve our products and  services. Currently we are in the process of developing a new drone. With this we need to come  up with something new, something diﬀerent. Find our target audience and work around their  needs to create the ultimate drone.

Selection

As we are designing the drone in house it is clear to start with the visualisation tool to discover our  needs, our clients needs, designs, and put our ideas into a picture. Allowing us to put our ideas  together and think about possibilities we haven’t seen before.

Application

For our ﬁst visualisation tool we started with everyone in the team putting up their ideas on a  board in picture, word and design form. This lead to lots of discussions about diﬀerent types of  idea and brought up new ideas which we also added to the board. For the second part we took all  our ideas and started to see patterns, situations it can be used for and diﬀerent segments. Our  challenge was to pick out which to leave out and focus on whats important and doing so in a  group, everyone is diﬀerent and cant agree on everything.

Insight

By applying the visualisation tool, my team and I identiﬁed our key solutions and design ideas and  built a better understanding of where and how we move forward and create a more eﬃcient  workﬂow. The results were much better than expected and we though more broadly than we have  in previous meetings, discovering several new use cases for our drone which we will be pursuing.

Approach

This new way of discovering ideas had a big impact on the team and is deﬁnitely something we  are going to continue using in our brainstorming phase. Moving forward we will analyse all the  information we have put together and use it to generate story around it in video form and put the  customer experience and usage in focus. Then push it out to a select group and analyse the  responses. This will give us a better understanding of what the end user thinks of the product and  if theres anything we’ve missed in our design thinking process.

Learning Launch

Challenge

My name is Annie and surname is Annie. . I am very interested in programming and web design. I  have been doing graphic design since the 1st year of university and I was taught at the university what  programs to work with, but when the quarantine began in 2020 due to the coronavirus, I was forced to  study all other programs myself and I did it well, especially when I have a desire to strive for more

Selection

I have selected this because it is something more creative and using your brain and knowledge in  different situations which helped me in different scenarios to come up with a better solution

Application

It can be used in different field like in our education when we are preparing for a particular topic and it  can be applied in real time too. Using this mind mapping we can come up with a new way of thinking. It  helped me a lot by using this method

Insight

Using this method I could think in many different ways to solve a particular problem and come with a best  solution as much as possible.

Approach

Using this method I could think in many different ways to solve a particular problem and come with a  best solution as much as possible.I would even try approaching this in different way too in other  situations when I come up with a  scenario in my life. I happy to apply it by myself and solve the problem my own.

REFLECTION- LEARNING LAUNCH

Francisco Parra

Challenge

I am a Business major student and, recently, one of my projects was to entrepreneur an online  business. My team and I decided to develop the ideas around a pet shop that sells accessorizes  and costumes for dogs and cats designed by us. On last October we started the meetings to  organize the activities; our challenge was to start operations by December 2020, and that our  products had to be successfully sold, we had to present results at our project manager. The  resources that we had were limited (financial specifically) so we wanted to be sure that our  investments were not to be wasted. Therefore we focused on looking for the products that would  gave us more profits considering that our products were going to be manufactured by us, we  needed to know the combination of products that would gave us the highest profits.

Selection

Since we wanted to know the successfully products, all of us realized that the only way was to  started sealing different accessorizes in small quantities. As a result of our reflections, we decided  that using the learning launch tool to make different experiments by sell small combination  products.

Application

For the first learning launch the products that we put on sale were all designed and manufactured  by our team. At first we had some messages asking for them and their prices but only a couple of  them were reflected in request. Even though our sales were not a lot, we face difficulties on the  shipment costs; sometimes it was more expensive than the product price. The learning launch let  us discovered that this issue was an important impediment for people to order. As a small  business some of the directions of delivery were too far and the costs were expensive to afford  them.

For the second learning launch, we decided to offer less designs but on more sizes, so on the  manufacturing area we focused on specific designs and guaranty the quality that we wanted to  maintain. We saw a solution for the problem with de shipment costs by increase the price of each  product; with this strategy we can apportion that cost on all the products: no matter where you  live, shipment is free.

Insight

By applying this tool we discovered not only the correct mix of products that give us the highest  amount of profit, it also showed other different problems on areas such as delivery, manufacturing  and quality.

We had troubles with the result of the experiments, even though it helped us, some of us still  believed that some of our products were the best idea to sell, even though the costumers didn’t  had the same opinion. It was hard to accept that sometimes the ideas that you appreciate the  most are not the profitable ones. The hardest part was to opening our minds to make changes to

our original plan; the results made us realized that it was too early to develop many of our ideas.  The business is steel in the initial phase, we decided to keep operating with the second experiment  information, and it is working well until today. Soon we want to put in practice another  experiment with brand new products to expand the offer to our customers.

Approach

We were able to obtain relevant information as a result; it can be said that we choose the correct  tool. The success of the application of the tool depends not only on developing experiments, but  also making a mind preparing to appreciate and evaluate the results objectively. Therefore,  practice will make us use the tool efficiently and makes us feel more comfortable developing  experiments.

Design Thinking for Innovation – Coursera Course by Luna Arias

Reflection – Learning Launch

Challenge    Last year I was part of a team that had the task of analyzing the causes that led to a  small club in my city not being able to add new members.  Initially we meet with various stakeholders to better understand the current situation.  Among them were partners, ex-partners, employees, parents of children who play  sports at the facilities, managers, fans, etc. From those conversations we obtained  preliminary information indicating that the activities the club had to offer were difficult to  search for. We were asked to create a new web system together with an app to be able  to link the member more directly with the club, providing information of interest, digital  membership card, access to digital facilities, calendar, etc.      Selection    In this creation process, several Design Thinking tools such as Mind Mapping and  Rapid Prototyping were used along the way, so the team became interested in the  Learning Launch technique to test the designs based on all the previous information  collected.      Application    Two days were held at the club's facilities to test the ideas and prototypes. On the first  day, stakeholders such as members, parents, former members and the general public  not associated with the club were invited to test a first version of the mobile application  resulting from a rapid prototyping. These people were interviewed according to a  rehearsed script to make them feel as comfortable as possible, and were discreetly  filmed for further behavior analysis. From this day on, valuable metrics emerged for the  following stages.      Insight    From the commented sessions, it was possible to extract highly valuable data to  identify what the user's workflow was like within the application. Thus, certain screens  with options were observed that presented a higher level of difficulty than the one  desired for the public, which led to generating new designs and tests to reach a  satisfactory result. The web application was also tested with people with some degree  of visual or motor disability, to guarantee its accessibility and access without any type  of restrictions.      Approach    Given that our team has implemented other Design Thinking tools in the project in the  past, we believe that a Learning Launch is the appropriate tool to continue

incorporating improvements iteratively from the insights, and in this way to be able to  get closer to the final product that has meaning for the public as well as for the club.

MIND MAP

1. Challenge

Currently, my friends and I did a start-up about self-development applications.

Sometimes we found some difficulties in working together. For example, most of the

information comes in a non-organized, non-structured way, making it harder for me and

everyone else to absorb and utilize it. So, the way I’d phrase the challenge would be: how

can we improve our start-up by structuring information we handle in a simple, can be

visualized and knowing the relationship between that information that we have.

2. Selection

Our team uses a variety of design thinking tools, one of which is the Mind Map. Mind

Map is visually organized information that is designed to help us in collaboration and

communication.

3. Application

I use a mind map for structuring information to make it simple, can be visualized, and

knowing the relationship in a way I do organize the dozens of things that the team has to

coordinate. Every project basically contains the same items: scope (what’s in, what’s

out), timeline (dates, milestones), costs, resources (people, equipment), risks, and

assumptions. but, the hardest part of learning a new subject, is visualizing how big it is

and how its concepts and details are interconnected.

4. Insight

My insight about one of the design thinking tools, which is the mind map. I think by

making a mind map in the team, we have an idea of the performance we have been

through. In addition, we can also understand each other's ideas efficiently, the purpose of

the applications we develop is even clearer. Because the idea that we have is too big or

too complex for us to rely only on our memories. Here’s where the mind mapping helps a

lot.

5. Approach

As I am seeing the benefits of mind maps in our team, I definitely plan to continue using

the tool. But, I think that sometimes the map itself can oversimplify an idea because it

only contains a broad core not including important details. Overall, I do satisfy with the

mind map that helps me to simplify some ideas. Therefore, I confidently say that I would

like to explore more design thinking tools that will help me and my friend in developing

our small start-up.

Saadiah Jie

Final Assignment

Leonardo Giles

Challenge & Selection

The challenge I chose is to help young people (college and university), who have  difficulty in socializing and have mental health problems; since they do not have  confidence in openly asking for help from their parents, teachers, classmates,  among others. The tool used for this challenge will be the mental mapping tool,  which I found very useful for interacting with this group of people, and getting the  report that they can provide for possible solutions.

Application

The first action that I will take will be to contact several people, who have gone  through the problem in question, have coped with it in a positive way or are still  facing the problem, and are willing to share their experience that will serve as a  reference for young people who are in the similar situation.

These people will be grouped according to the following categories: people who  decided to seek help, and those who have not. Based on the aforementioned  categories, they will be presented on a blackboard with an idea for their category.  The former will contribute ideas based on their experience and what led them to  request help, as well as what kind of help they would have liked to have; while,  for the second group, they will contribute ideas of why they have not wanted to  seek help, there have been reasons of disgust for asking for help, among others.  At the end of the activity I will gather and organize all the ideas contributed to  determine the best factor to help and solve the problem.

Insight & Aproach

What I have learned from carrying out this activity with the selected tool is that  the more people are involved with facing the challenge, the greater perspectives  will be obtained to solve the problems of the vast majority of the people who face  them and not just a minority. similar to my thought process. In addition, we could  involve people who do not have this condition but who have the empathy to help  their peers.

I think that for the next occasion I would support myself with the visualization tool,  since it has a similar objective to that of mind mapping, but with this tool it will be  possible to reach a global vision of the problem and, consequently, its solution.

Assignment Rubric

Hi! I’m Alison from Indonesia. I am a graphic designer.

For me, the design thinking tools that I am interested in applying to a challenge I

had is Mind Mapping.

In the company I work at, it’s hard to make significant social media engagement

growth. Every content that we share always has a different result that sometimes makes

me question why this content doesn’t work, while the previous content gains so much

engagement. Is this because of the trend? But some content of course don’t follow the

trend because it's educational content or promotion content.

The submission’s challenge description could be improved by analyzing the

audience habit from the way they respond to the content. Like their comments and

enthusiasm. Also observing the ages, occupation, habit, etc. Even though I hope that I still

have a chance to interview our audience directly.

The Mind Mapping tools help me to figure out what I should do with the data

(audience habit, ages, occupation, etc). What kind of content that they want or need, what

kind of visuals that may atract their attention, how to communicate this content verbally

and visually.

Like for the 20-25 years olds audiences and the 30+ audiences, the way they

perceive the information is different. It could be about the topic, the young ages may be

more curious about the example that impacts their life so it's more easy to understand.

While the mature ages may be curious about how these things impact my career/job.

However, I am still in the process of doing the exploration and experiment, trial and

error. Hopefully the result will be good as time goes by.

As designers, I try to make the visual so that the audience can easily understand the

information. Like the paragraf content, I try to visualize with infographics or attractive

illustrations. The font size should be not too big and not too small and a good hierarchy.

Every content should be consistent but dynamic, also following the trend.

But sometimes it’s difficult for me because some people just look at the content as

‘visual’ things. Some people do not really care about the visual, as long as it can be read

easily and done. While as designers, the expectation is not only that they read, but also

understand and consistently follow our content, maybe comment, share and take other

action from this content.

Thank you so much.
